intro: Otopappus salazarii, commonly known as the Salazarii's thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Otopappus salazarii is often found in coastal areas and is considered a hardy, drought-resistant species.
